page.title: 02Employment in Lacock
page.content: As Lacock is a small village in a rural area, very few people are employed locally. Some find work on local farms, in the egg packing factory and in the garden centre, and in the village itself seasonal work is available in tourist related industries like food preparation and cleaning of the Abbey. Most people who live in and around Lacock, therefore, have to travel to Melksham, Chippenham and Trowbridge to find employment. They pursue a wide variety of trades and professions varying from managing director of a national company, a bank manager, college lecturers and a thatcher to factory workers and lorry drivers. Unfortunately there is some unemployment and school leavers in the area find it hard to find suitable work.
